docinfo.docinfo:doc-heading: [454,685] Form 142 REQUIREMENT BY LIQUIDATOR UNDER SECTION 384(1) OF THE CODE

heading.title: [454,685] Form 142 REQUIREMENT BY LIQUIDATOR UNDER SECTION 384(1) OF THE CODE

leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: [454,685] Form 142 REQUIREMENT BY LIQUIDATOR UNDER SECTION 384(1) OF THE CODE

leg:heading.title: REQUIREMENT BY LIQUIDATOR UNDER SECTION 384(1) OF THE CODE

text.emph: (Requirement by liquidator under section 384(1) of the Code)

h.emph: REQUIREMENT TO PAY MONEY, etc TO LIQUIDATOR

p.text: 1. I am the liquidator of (name of Company).

2. Pursuant to section 384(1) of the Companies (New South Wales) Code, I require you to pay (or deliver, convey, surrender or transfer) to me, forthwith (or not later than (number) days from the date of this requirement) (or such time as the liquidator directs) $(or describe the property or books)
[or any money, property or books to which the Company is prima facie entitled.

"accounting records" includes invoices, receipts, orders for the payment of money, bills of exchange, cheques, promissory notes, vouchers and other documents of prime entry and also includes such working papers and other documents as are necessary to explain the methods and calculations by which accounts are made up;
"books" includes any register or other record of information and any accounts or accounting records, however compiled, recorded or stored, and also includes any document;
a reference to writing shall be construed as including a reference to any mode of representing or reproducing words, figures or symbols in a visible form;
"printed" includes type-written, lithographed or reproduced by any mechanical means; and
any paper or other material on which there is writing or printing, or on which there are marks, symbols, or perforations having a meaning for persons qualified to interpret them; and

a disc, tape or other article from which sounds, images or messages are capable of being reproduced and, without limiting the generality of the foregoing, includes any summons, order and other legal process and any notice.
"property" means any legal or equitable interest (whether present or future and whether vested or contingent) in real or personal property of any description and includes things in action].
[Form 142 insrt Amendment 126: Gaz 90 of 30 June 1982 p 2973]
